Reviews.Title: “week end in london”
Reviews.Author: Riccardo B
Reviews.Content: Close to paddington from where you can reach easily most common destinations. Rooms are clean and if you get a room looking at the court, like we had, it's very quiet. There is no lift but there are only three floors, it's not a big effort. Staff it's friendly and reception is open 24x7. You can leave your luggage at the reception after check-out for free. Beakfast is normally included but we can't say about the quality because we never had it. The block is nice and full of others similar hotels. Restaurants and pubs are available nearby. Very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a Hotell.no traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights and I think this hotel is excellent value for money. It is a typical London hotel, could do with a refurbishment, but works well as it is. We got a big room (number 24). The bed was comfortable, and we didn´t hear any noise from the neighbours apart from when they were in the corridor. The shower took forever to heat, I think we left it on hot for almost ten minutes before it was possible to step into the shower, but apart from that the bathroom was ok. Breakfast was not really up to standards. We opted for English breakfast and the bacon was rubbery and the tomatoes were from a can, "rösti" potatoes seemed prefabricated (almost inedible). But nice toast, butter and jam, and the eggs were good. We didn´t try the continental breakfast, as we just had breakfast at a café our second day. Would stay here again if on a budget trip, good location and a quiet area.

Reviews.Title: ““Great Location and Great Room””
Reviews.Author: Holly-Jonathan
Reviews.Content: What a find for London! Small double room with own bathroom all very clean indeed. Room cleaned every day. Not much in the way of toiletries some soap, so be sure to take your own toiletries, but clean towels provided each day. Our room was on the front third floor so I heard some traffic noise when window was open. Very nice breakfast - cereal and fruit juice, choice of bacon/egg/beans, scrambled egg and toast, jam, tea or coffee. Excellent value for money, particularly as it is close to Paddington underground and train station and a great bus routes. It is about a 10 minute walk to Hyde Park, Marble Arch and Oxford Street is close too, if you wish to shop till you drop, and quick bus to the West End. Would stay again without hesitation. Thanks to the host family for making our stay an enjoyable one.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible room”
Reviews.Author: Alison G
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two night in a hot, dirty, poky room (number 2). We asked for a fan for the night, but there was none. The toilet was so small that the sink gets in the way of your arm! The shower had excellent water pressure but also dirty and moldy. The staff were average but not terribly helpful. The breakfast was also average. The location is certainly good but there are many other hotels and B+Bs nearby.

Reviews.Title: “good place to stay as a base”
Reviews.Author: EilsC
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the europa house hotel 3 times in the last 3 years with my mum and daughter. On my first trip to london 4 years ago i wanted a place close to city centre, transport and not too expensive. The europa house hotel lives up to that. accomodation is clean and tidy and in the 2 rooms i've stayed in was plenty of storage. room 22 is my fav. Staff are lovely and very accomidating. My only flaw is a bigger breakfast as where wanted to be full for a days traveling. Us irish love a good fry up. For a continetal breakie very good. Also a good pub just 2 mins up road.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel for OK price”
Reviews.Author: travel_d_z Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Relatively decently priced accommodation sufficient for a short week-end trip to London. Pros: - Walking distance to several tube stations - Good price - Basic breakfast included - Helpful staff Cons: - no elevator - door lock malfunctioned, we really struggled with opening the door - no wifi - room quite cold - very old furniture (the wardrobe seemed at least 70 years old) - slightly shabby beds (only twin beds, no double bed) - bed blankets looked really old and we wouldn't dare use them

Reviews.Title: “Cheap comfortable, clean room with ensuite bathroom and good breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: helpr
Reviews.Content: The room was on the top floor and there was no lift. The positive was that this floor was quiet apart from the traffic on Sussex Gardens. The room had a clean, modern ensuite bathroom but the plumbing did not allow a temperature controlled shower! The sheets were crisp, clean white cotton but the duvet cover had been on for a week or so before. The room was so warm however that the duvet could be kicked onto the floor and one could just sleep under the sheet. The staff were friendly and helpful. The breakfast was comparatively good offering a good variety even free range eggs. I was a single woman traveller and felt safe in this hotel. On the whole very good value for money and I would use them again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money & Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Toscanabella
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the hotel. Only a short 5 minute walk from Paddington Tube station (with trains to Heathrow every 15mins as well), with plenty of good shops, restaurants and things to do close by; the location couldn't be more perfect. Overall, I would definitely stay at this hotel again. The breakfast was fantastic -- choice between English (fry up -- eggs, bacon, beans, tomato, hash brown etc.), or continental (yogurt, jam, cereal etc.). The hotel has no lift, however, and the staff do not offer to carry your bags up the stairs which are very narrow. So if you have lots of luggage and/or are elderly/infirm or have small children, perhaps this hotel isn't a good choice for you. Our triple room was rather small, but nothing to complain about. It was clean, bright, and neat. The heating in the room was a little too intense and we always had to open the window. Also it was a little disappointing that basic toiletries were not provided, but this is only a very minor complaint. We really liked that there was a TV in the room with plenty of channels to choose from. Also, we enjoyed the free WiFi. Just go down to reception and ask for the password. On account of the heat in the room, it did take us a while to drift off to sleep, but once again, nothing major to complain about. The staff at reception aren't particularly friendly -- particularly on arrival we didn't recieve a warm welcome, but the breakfast ladies were very hospitable. Overall, it's a good budget hotel -- you get what you pay for. As I said, it's pretty good value for money and in an unbeatable location.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: FunnyAnimal
Reviews.Content: The room was small, but acceptable. I have been in much smaller singles. The hotel location is great, close to tube, rail, shopping, sights, etc. Breakfast was good. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “quite OK”
Reviews.Author: fede78
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is very well located and certainly has the potential to be a destination I'd choose again for a weekend. I read other reviews and seems i was quite lucky, I was on the 4th floor and the room was tiny but OK. Certainly the cleaner doesn't do the best job ever but that's ok, for 55 pound a night in Paddington you probably can't expect more. She didn't change towels daily and i kept on using mine but eventually the 3rd day they were changed (i expected a daily change). The only real problem is the heat in the room, the heating works constantly day and night but i could solve the problem by sleeping with my feet toward the window where the heather was (so re arranging myself the sheets on the bed) and by keeping the window a little open overnight. Finally when i arrived there was no soap in the bathroom but they provided me at the reception. The hotel seems to be a family run business by a Spanish family.

Reviews.Title: “shabby and neglected”
Reviews.Author: jeannie-italy
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a basement room with wallpaper peeling off the walls. The hot water was very temperamental, the shower was alternately hot and cold, and completely cold on the last day. I told the receptionist and he just shrugged his shoulders. The bathroom had the tiniest washbasin with a shelf above it, which made it practically impossible to clean your teeth. I also discovered that someone had been in the room and opened my suitcase while we were out in the evening. The only positive aspect is that you get an English breakfast of sorts, and it's very conveniently located.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: jbennettwales
Reviews.Content: basic,clean and central.you don't need anything else.an enjoyable stay.would go back

Reviews.Title: “A little worse than some, but alot better than others.”
Reviews.Author: lorrainewells267
Reviews.Content: Stayed four days, with my mother, apart from being placed on the second floor (the stairs seemed to get steeper every day!), the room was quiet, clean, comfortable. It was excellent value for money, especially with the delicious cooked breakfast included in price. We found the staff very polite, and pleasant. Managed to get internet connection, even on 2nd floor, (receptionist had been very helpful and gave me several connections to try). For us, it was a great location, as my daughter lives a few minutes walk away, and we were near to Paddington and Lancaster Gate tube stations, which enable you to get pretty much anywhere in London. The only down side (apart from the stairs), was the tiny en suite, and the fact that the tiny hand basin was a 'slow drainer', my Mum and I managed, with the very small space,but, we could appreciate, that someone less mobile, or bigger built could encounter problems. The shower was surprisingly good. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for the cost but some staff are very impolite”
Reviews.Author: kelanmc
Reviews.Content: On a recent visit to London, myself and my girlfriend were left high and dry by hotels.com not once but twice. Firstly booking the Holland Court Hotel, which upon further inspection would not appear to be out of place in a Nairobi Shanty, and secondly booking the Dolphin Hotel in Paddington, who cancelled our booking via email without informing hotels.com. So with our fingers well and truly burnt we were forced to rebook the night before we arrived. Considering this fact, we got a very reasonable deal on this hotel at Â£88.00 per room per night, staying for 4 nights over a weekend. Upon arrival we breathed a sigh of relief as the hotel appeared to be clean and respectable. However there were a few problems with our stay. I refuse to make a sweeping statement about the staff because the majority of those we encountered were lovely and very helpful. Nonetheless upon check in we were greeted by a receptionist who was less than enthusiastic about her job. Having handed her the email verifying our booking she insisted on keeping the email, regardless of the fact that it was our only proof of payment. When I refused she looked at me in disbelief, and after I suggested she photocopy the page she stated that she didn't know how to use the photocopier, and spent about 5 minutes grumbling trying to get it working. All very disconcerting for an establishment priding itself on the treatment of its customers. Having had a long flight we then decided to get a cup of tea, but there was no sugar in our room. I headed to the kitchen to grab some sugar sachets and was immediately asked by the same woman 'what are you doing here?' and when I explained myself she said 'no, you're not allowed', as if she were scorning a child. I really wouldn't have a problem with being informed that there was some alternative method of procuring sugar if I wasn't treated in this manner. If the receptionist for instance said, 'Sorry sir, but our dining room is currently closed, is there anything I can help you with?' it would have been much more acceptable. An extension of this gripe includes the housekeepers for the hotel. When running late for breakfast one morning my girlfriend kept her pjyama bottoms on so we'd get to the kitchen on time. Apart from this she was properly clothed and was even wearing shoes. In essence her bottoms were indistinguishable from sweatpants. Upon arrival in the kitchen one of the Polish girls working there shoed my girlfriend out of the kitchen berating her for turning up to breakfast in the bottoms. Announcing to the room that pjyama bottoms were not acceptable rather than taking the tactful approach of having a quiet word with us. To prove how pedantic a point this is, the next morning my girlfriend went to breakfast in the same pjyama bottoms while the owner was having breakfast. Whilst in the presence of the owner the housekeeper in question couldn't have been nicer to us, even telling us to have a nice day as we left the room. She didn't bat an eyelid at the fact that my girlfriend was wearing pjyamas this time. How does that old saying go? 'When the cat's away the mice will play.' In short, some members of the staff of this hotel have severe difficulties with common courtesy and tact, which annoys me as I work in a industry where our customer turnover is based on high standards of service. It's really not that much of an effort to be polite to people, especially in order to capitalise upon return sales. Having said all this, the majority of the staff we in fact very helpful, with several receptionists assisting us in acquiring numbers for restaurants and directions to attractions. I am in fact going to chalk some of this up to culture shock. Being from Dublin where everybody is very receptive I have become acclimatised to interaction with people I don't necessary know. This is epitomised for instance by people nodding to each other on the street or flashing a smile as they pass by. My girlfriend while in Paddington flashed a smile at an elderly couple, to which their reaction was one of shock. I have to say that the only night that felt remotely like home was when we went to an Aussie bar. I have come to the conclusion that English people are not as friendly as the Irish, but being rude to your own customers is really shooting yourself in the foot. Apart from my obvious grievances over manners, the hotel was generally nice. Our room was spacious and airy. The television was great. The breakfast was above and beyond what we were expecting, constituting an English fry. The rooms were clean, although there was some wallpaper peeling from the wall beside our window. The ensuites were clean. The only issue with the ensuite was that the shower was too powerful for the curtain and the floor often ended up wet, but it dried up quick enough. The price as aforementioned was very reasonable. The location was great. Paddington is full of nice little restaurants where we ate every night. Sussex Gardens itself is very picturesque with lines of whitewashed Georgian buildings, and Paddington station itself is on the Hammersmith, Circle, District and Bakerloo lines, making Piccadilly a five minute trip away, and everywhere else in London easily accessable. All in all I would recommend this hotel as its benefits heavily outweigh its detractors, but go being aware of the issues I have discussed.

Reviews.Title: “A little hiccup but solved quickly”
Reviews.Author: Abertawetraveller
Reviews.Content: When arriving at this hotel with my husband, as the distance states it is only about a 3 minute walk from Paddington. However when going to check in the lady receptionist informed us that there was a problem with the shower in our room so was told we have been moved next door to the Queensway. This was hardly an inconvienience as we could still return to the Europa for the English breakfast we had paid for. I have reviewed the Queensway as this is where we stayed in all. The only bad thing i would say is that the 2 ladies serving breakfast need an extra person as the breakfast was extensive, the continental my husband had consisted of cereal, croissants, yoghurt and ham and cheese and the English i opted for was a lovely start to the day. A few little things were amiss cereal wthout milk and tables not cleared quickly enough but thats the only slight problem.

Reviews.Title: “Low budget but clean, Good for what it is.”
Reviews.Author: ratio
Reviews.Content: Definitely a no frills place. The breakfast is plentiful, edible and hot. The street noise was uncomfortable for us suburban folk (active street till 3 or 4 AM). This wouldn't have been as much of an issue if we'd been able to close our window, but a heat wave (90F) and no air condition left little choice. Good location for walking or tubing to major attractions in London.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel. Good breakfasts.”
Reviews.Author: chrigurn
Reviews.Content: I use this little hotel quite often when I'm on business in London. It's a small no-nonsense family run hotel, very close to Paddington station. Rooms are small, but adequate. Staff are friendly and the breakfasts (included in the room rate) are good. Only complaint is that every time I've stayed there, the tea-making tray in the room never seems to have any milk. There is free WiFi, but only if you're put in a room close to reception.

Reviews.Title: “A basic budget hotel located in a good quiet location”
Reviews.Author: Travelexperience12
Reviews.Content: When we arrived (before published check-in time), we were checked in and our bags were held for us to collect when our room was ready. The room was adequate for our one night stay with a very comfortable bed. Surprisingly the hotel contact telephone number in the room, to be provided if reporting an emergency was several years out of date and could not be reached. This was reported to reception. The current number was on normal hotel publicity. The washroom was very small and the shower had very limited space. Breakfast was served in an airy basement room. A good range of food was on offer and served by very pleasant staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location at great price.”
Reviews.Author: ATALIAIsrael
Reviews.Content: Situated just a few minutes walk from Paddington and Lancaster Gate stations this small cheap hotel was ideal for our stay. Despite booking a double we were given room 22 in the basement which has a double and single bed making it spacious. Add to this a cupboard and a chest of drawers as well as in room kettle with tea coffee and milk. Breakfast great with a choice between Continental and English breakfasts. I shall definitely try and rebook here next time in London.

Reviews.Title: “Standard of room OK given the price but bathroom very poor.”
Reviews.Author: 55011Andy Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Only a one night stay - bedroom was OK with comfy bed & Breakfast was OK . BUT let down by very poor bathroom - (GF room to rear) Shower - Chrome peeling off shower head & bar. Unable to adjust temperature satisfactorily - borderline between being frozen or scalded. The shower curtain was covered in black mould. No hot water in the evening when we arrived. The drain in the floor centre wasn't tiled right up to leaving a gap which could cause an injury to feet . Paint peeling off coving on the ceiling . Also the basin was very small - the sort that you would normally only find in a WC.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Price and Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Andrew3104
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights with our 3 kids aged 14,13 & 10 and found it to be a fantastic location close to Paddington station for easy access to central London. The breakfast served was also a great way to start each day and the staff were really lovely.

Reviews.Title: “first rate value for money b&b”
Reviews.Author: frankitBath
Reviews.Content: Room and ensuite spotless, just ensure when booking that any elderly or infirm travellers check they're not on the top floors as there's no lift. Full English breakfast included in price which was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “It was the only mistake we made for our trip”
Reviews.Author: tripwatch-us
Reviews.Content: As I said it was the only mistake we made for our Europe trip. We will definitely not going to stay there again. When we got there, we would told that they double booked our room and needed to send us to his Uncle's place next door (later we found out, they have no relationship at all). The room we had was so small that there is no place to put our two small luggages. Two beds were sinked in the middle. Worst of all, they did not tell us that towels are only changed every THREE days. On the second day, they picked up our towels from the bethroom floor and expected us to re-use them. In the middle of the last night when we all slept, the owner called and ask us for the payment. After all, there is the worst hotel we have ever stayed in our life and really don't want to try again.

Reviews.Title: “Tidy Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: tige1968
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night in June, from Paddington Station its an easy 5min walk and therefore easy acess to all major attractions, the lady in reception was pleasant and our room was tidy and suited us well. The breakfast service was slow but for the price we could not complain, I would stay at this place again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accomodation for a low cost”
Reviews.Author: NWSNZ
Reviews.Content: I chose Europa House Hotel online when in New Zealand for it's close proximity to Paddington Station and low cost. My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights. This hotel exceeded my expectations. We were in room 9 which was large with a double and single bed. Very comfortable and warm with views to the street below. The bathroom was very compact (to be expected), but renovated to a high standard so was much appreciated considering the low cost of the rooms here. I would highly recommend Europa House Hotel to the budget conscious traveler as London is not a cheap place to stay, particularly so close to the city. The owners and staff were very friendly and accommodating and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: Adelaidean_9
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Europa House for 6 nights in January and was extremely impressed with the location, it's a lovely quiet street. Getting my suitcase up to the top floor was not fun but the room was fine with a tiny but recently renovated bathroom and a small LCD TV with digital channels. Breakfasts were good, with a choice of continental or english, though they could heat up their baked beans a bit more. I would highly recommend this hotel as it's so close to Paddington and Lancaster Gate tube stations and Hyde Park. I also managed to find a cheap laundromat nearby which is always handy.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: PennyE
Reviews.Content: Looking for convenient location, reasonable price and hearty breakfast, this is your destination. We have stayed here multiple times over 13 years and have always found Fran to be most helpful. Rooms are small and bathrooms are small but you can't beat it for the price, breakfast and location. The neighborhood is quite charming and the pubs are filled with locals as well as tourists. Rooms are being refurbished and updated and the tranformation is positive.

Reviews.Title: “Cute place to stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelGirl1989
Reviews.Content: A few friends and I stayed at this hotel for 12 days recently. Because of the length of our stay they gave us an EXCELLENT discount. The breakfast was delicious and FAR better than the typical free breakfast you recieve at most hotels. Most of the staff seemed to have trouble understanding us, despite the fact that we speak english. However, the owners were very wonderful people that understood and helped us completely. The location is great. It is right by Paddignton station which connects pretty much anywhere you could want to go. There are plenty of places to eat right by there also. I would recommend the location to everyone! The rooms are very tiny so, if you're looking for a really nice hotel to spend lots of time inside, then this is not the right place. However, if you're anything like my friends and I, and want a comfortable place to sleep while you enjoy your time in London, I highly recommend this hotel! My only complaint is that our room was on the 3rd floor, so each day we had to hike up 60 steps to our room. This wasn't really an issue except when we were transporting our luggage up and down!...but hey, it was good exercise! Overall, if you're on a budget definitely stay here! It is probably the best value for your money!

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: AvidTravellers56
Reviews.Content: We agree with Mobsta from Bournemouth!! And from Mobsta's photos it looks like we stayed in the same room (first one at the top of the stairs!!) We were en route from Australia to Athens and spent 3 night stop over in London. Room so small you couldn't swing a cat and had to step over our suitcases to get around bed as hanging space was non-existent, radiator never heated up so freezing cold, 1 flat pillow each and no extras. As you will see by Mobsta's photos, the shower/toilet cubicle was terrible and you couldn't call it an ensuite like their web site does. We also took the same photos to show our friends.......... Rooms like this shouldn't be rented out until they're refurbished!!! Staffing: Every time we went to reception to leave/collect our room key or ask a touristy question, staff was on a "personal" call on his mobile phone and never ever interrupted his calls to deal with hotel guests - customer service??? Breakfast: The menu says eggs (plural) and bacon but you only received 1 and were ignored when you requested 2. We definitely would not stay here again nor recommend it. Fortunately all other accommodation during our 6 week holiday in Europe and the UK lived up to their web site spiels and photos .

Reviews.Title: “Not good, Strange substances!!”
Reviews.Author: Robert M
Reviews.Content: We have just returned form a 1 night stay the the Europa House Hotel. We stayed in Room # 4 which was quite a small room, with a double bed in it, which is normal for London, but the toilet/shower room was abysmal and there was a strange substance in the hand basin that was not identifiable but did resemble some kind of excrement. Also in the bedroom area there was some splatter marks on the lower wall which looked very similar to dried blood, which wasnt very nice at all. The room was 'simpy' decorated with a duvet blanket and one very flat pillow per side of the bed. The room was also very cold, although there was a radiator in the room it seems as if they are not using it as yet so the room was very cold. The best thing about the room was the flat screen Tv which had FREEVIEW satellite channels and a clear picture. Our room rate of Â£85per night including breakfast from Laterooms.com was quite high for the quality of the room and as the room was so horrible we didnt have much faith in the breakfast so we didnt bother going down for that. All in all, I wouldnt stay here again, not even for Â£50 per night! Pictures attached!!

Reviews.Title: “A very friendly owner”
Reviews.Author: Great108
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on my visit from Washington DC. We were family of four. This was a clean hotel with a very welcoming staff. Neighborhood is good and safe, close to metro. There is a bus stop also close by. Either bus or train be got in 10/15 minutes walk. For us with a faily of four cab was a good option as the cab cost around 10uk to central London. Overall from my side ***** Rajesh

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Accomodation”
Reviews.Author: ccranny01
Reviews.Content: It was my first time in London and having read a lot of reviews on Trip Advisor about London hotels I wasn't expecting much. But to be honest this place had the best reviews I could find for the amount of money I wanted to spend. And lets face it if you're there to sight see then all you need is a bed, shower and somewhere to keep your bags! So for me this was a budget accomodation that fulfilled that need. Better value than a backpacker's place! I had a single room on the first floor and the room was an ok size, just enough room to swing a cat ... but only just! 8-) (Check out my photos). Room was clean and tidy. Shower was awesome! Plenty of hot water (which is a pleasant surprise compared to some of the places we stayed in Europe). TV had many channels to watch so that was good to be able to relax and watch after a hard day wondering around. However the highlight of the stay was the full English breakfasts every morning! Awesome and a great way to start the day! Staff were friendly and helpful (although there were some minor communication difficulties with some staff members). My only complaint is the wall thickness. It was quite noisy between rooms and I could hear the people in the room next to me clearly. Also unlucky me in room next to a snorer! Street noise could be bad for some who are light sleepers, but for me I got used to it. Great location - close to Kensington gardens makes it easy to get into the city centre (just hop on the underground tube). So overall a great value budget accomodation place to stay if you just need a bed for the night and a starting base for your sight seeing.

Reviews.Title: “DISHONEST OWNER”
Reviews.Author: chunclam
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Europa Ouse Hotel for 3 nights in the beginning of May. I was overall satisfied with the room and the service. But upon arriving home I realized that I had paid TWICE for the hotel bill. On the day I checked in they swiped my credit card, and I assumed that it was for 'guarrantee' and that they will swipe and charge the credit card again on the day I checked out. But on my last day there I decided to 'get rid 'of some remaining cash, so paid half of the bill by cash and the rest with credit card. When I realized what had happened, I sent them an email immediatelty demanding for my money to be returned. It's been 2 weeks now since I initiated contact with them and after several emails, I still haven't heard from them. They chose to ignore my request and keep the money. I'm angry with their dishonesty and appalled that they choose to sacrifice their good name and reputation for a mere GBP124 (that's what they owe me). So for potential customers in Europa House Hotel, be wary of the THIEF who is your host.

HotelInfo.Name: Europa House Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 151 Sussex Gardens | Hyde Park, London W2 2RY, England
